item.description:
Dinner and Speaker Night

"The Inherent Worth of Every Being: Expanding Our Interdependent Web"

with Rev. Gary Kowalski  

Presentation Open to all 7:15 pm/Pre-dinner requires reservation

Lasagna Dinner begins at 5:30 pm

$10 adults, children under 12 free.  BYO wine/beer/juice.

RSVP required by March 19th for dinner to kdshane1@verizon.net

 

Reverend Gary Kowalski is the author of The Souls of Animals, Goodbye Friend: Healing Wisdom For Anyone Who Has Ever Lost A Pet, The Bible According To Noah, Science and the Search for God, Earth Day: An Alphabet Book, and other volumes that celebrate the emotional and spiritual realities of love, conscience, imagination and joy that cross the species line.   Gary is a graduate of Harvard College and the Harvard Divinity School.  His books have been translated into German, French, Spanish, Japanese, Chinese and Czech and sold in the six figures around the world, and he's received numerous citations for preaching including the Skinner and Annual Program Fund Sermon Awards from the UUA.

Please Note: This event is part of a Reverence for Life Weekend program at the First Parish in Concord that begins Friday night March 23rd.  I've attached the flyer for Rev. Gary Kowalski and the agenda for the entire weekend as part of the files to this meet up.
item.name: Speaker Rev. Gary Kowalski and Plant-based Lasagna Dinner
